Represents: Age in years at time of MR imaging
Grade per the 2021 World Health Organization Classification of Tumors of the Central Nervous System (WHO CNS 2021) (https://doi.org/10.1093/neuonc/noab106)
Final (integrated) pathologic diagnosis per the 2021 World Health Organization Classification of Tumors of the Central Nervous System (WHO CNS 2021) (https://doi.org/10.1093/neuonc/noab106)
Values: Glioblastoma, Isocitrate dehydrogenase (IDH) -wildtype  ; Astrocytoma, IDH-mutant ; Astrocytoma, IDH-wildtype ; Oligodendroglioma, IDH-mutant, 1p/19q-codeleted

Represents: O6-methylguanine-DNA methyltransferase status - clinical interpretation of the MGMT index described below.

O6-methylguanine-DNA methyltransferase methylation index (in house method developed by UCSF clinical labs, https://genomics.ucsf.edu/content/mgmt-promoter-methylation-assay) where numeric values 0-17 indicate the number of promoter methylation sites.
presence of codeletion of 1p and 19q genes, assayed by fluorescent in-situ hybridization
isocitrate dehydrogenase mutation subtype characterized with a capture-based targeted next-generation DNA sequencing panel (UCSF500) as described in (https://doi.org/10.1093/neuonc/now254)
Survival status of the patient at last clinical follow up.
Overall survival in days from initial diagnosis to last clinical follow up.
Extent of resection determined by review of operative reports and immediate postoperative imaging.
Was a burr-hole biopsy performed prior to MRI acquisition?
